title: Birth in Calamba
text: Jos√© Protasio Rizal Mercado y Alonso Realonda was born on June 19, 1861, in Calamba, Laguna, Philippines.

title: Ateneo Graduation
text: Received his Bachelor of Arts degree from Ateneo Municipal de Manila with highest honors.

title: Travel to Europe
text: Left for Spain to pursue higher studies in medicine and philosophy at Universidad Central de Madrid.

title: Noli Me Tangere Published
text: Published his first novel 'Noli Me Tangere' in Berlin, exposing the social ills of Spanish colonial rule.

title: El Filibusterismo Published
text: Published his second novel 'El Filibusterismo' in Ghent, Belgium, depicting the consequences of revolution.

title: Return to Philippines
text: Returned to the Philippines and founded La Liga Filipina, a civic organization promoting reforms.

title: Exile to Dapitan
text: Exiled to Dapitan, Zamboanga del Norte, where he practiced medicine and taught local children.

title: Execution
text: Executed by firing squad at Bagumbayan (now Rizal Park) on December 30, 1896, becoming a martyr for Philippine independence.
